Key Arguments: The bill threatens basic liberties and freedom of speech.
It creates an imbalance of power by allowing certain groups to spread information while penalizing regular citizens.
The bill could lead to censorship and suppression of diverse viewpoints.
It may result in pre-censorship and echo chambers, stifling open discussion.
The legislation could be used to control narratives and influence democratic processes.
It imposes onerous regulations that could disadvantage smaller competitors in the digital space.
The bill fails to consider implications for religious freedom.
Notable Quotes: The bill contradicts our implicit rights as Australian Citizens with Marxist characteristics and should be withdrawn.
Free speech is required to ensure the integrity of our democracy.
The bill will lead to Pre-Censorship of Australian Citizens.
Blocking and Censorship leads to echo chambers.
